channel.title: Classic gameframe (delta)
channel.description: When I open up my server's cache in tom's cache editor, it shows up with an old school gameframe. When I log into my server, I don't have that old gameframe. So, in order for my server to load that gameframe upon log in, would I have to delete every file in my cache except for the .dat files?

item.title: Classic gameframe (delta)
item.dc:creator: @zzjimmy zzjimmy
item.description:
@zzjimmy wrote:

I guess I could try one out. Is there any good ones that you would recommend for my purposes?

Edit: I downloaded mendorphin’s developement package and found some deob’s with instructions on how to set them up but, I have two questions.

  1. How do I know which deob is compatible with my source?
  2. How do I get the deob to load the cache I downloaded?

Edit2: I followed a tut on how to get a deob to work but, when I run my client I get a connection error. I checked to see if there was something wrong with the cache but it was fine. So maybe the cache just isn’t being downloaded. What should I do?

Read full topic

item.title: Classic gameframe (delta)
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

I would suggest, if there is nothing special about your client you just download a deob and start from scratch. That’s what I did. It was the best decision I ever made.

Read full topic

item.title: Classic gameframe (delta)
item.dc:creator: @zzjimmy zzjimmy
item.description:
@zzjimmy wrote:

Okay, does that mean I would have to open up my client.java, or gui.java file, and change where the cache is being loaded from?

Edit: I have no java files in my client folder except for gui.java. Is it possible to convert a .class file into a .java file? If it is, how would I do it?

Edit2: I converted my .class files into .java files. I also figured out that class30_sub2_sub1_sub1 is the file that downloads the images. But now I’m even more confused. I’m not sure if I’m supposed to change the directory of every specific image to the .dat files in my cache because that would take forever. Even if I did, I’m not positive it will work.
I need some help please.

Read full topic

item.title: Classic gameframe (delta)
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

You need to make your client read from the cache. Not the sprites folder.

Read full topic
